moves.1... d6: Pirc Defence. I've played against this before, but I'm not too familiar with it.
moves.2. d4 e5: Already out of openings book, but seems fine to me.
moves.3. dxe5 dxe5 4. Qxd8+: Is this OK? I guess it throws black's castling opportunities away.
moves.6... f6: If I do Bxc6, Nxe5 afterwards no longer wins material. Would Bd6 have been better though?
moves.7. Bxc6 bxc6: Trying to trade against strong opponents.
moves.14. Bxd6 cxd6 15. Rxd6: Gains material, but is this OK?
moves.15... Rb6: Probably not too good, as trading behind generally isn't a good idea.
moves.18... Ke7: Maybe he was hoping to kill pawn.
moves.19. Rd1 Rd8: Putting pressure on d5, but the pawn is still safe.
moves.20. Nh4: Hoping to do Nf5, forcing the black king to move further away from the pawn. Were there better options?
moves.21. d6+: Check. Would this normally be OK?
moves.22. Nf5+: He resigned here. Feel free to comment and give constructive criticism.
